title: Uncle of boy, 8, who was shot by playmate turns self in
content:
GALVESTON - The uncle of an 8-year-old boy shot in the face by a playmate surrendered Thursday on charges related to his alleged failure to supervise the children.
Marcus Allen Garrett, 31, of Texas City surrendered to sheriff's deputies at the Galveston County Jail on charges of abandoning and endangering a child as well as a drug charge related to cocaine found during a search of his apartment, Texas City police Capt. Joe Stanton said.
Garrett's bond has been set at $550,000.
The drug charge carries a maximum penalty of life imprisonment and a $10,000 fine; the abandonment charge carries 2 to 20 years in prison and a potential $10,000 fine.
Police said the 8-year-old, whose name has not been released, and his 9-year-old brother and a 7-year-old cousin were placed in Garrett's care by his two sisters Sunday. The children told police that Garrett left the apartment and did not return. The 7-year-old found a .308-caliber semi-automatic pistol that discharged, striking the 8-year-old in the face, police said.
The child was taken by helicopter ambulance to Hermann Memorial-Texas Medical Center where he underwent surgery. The hospital has not released his condition.
